definition: v. 称赞，赞扬；n. 赞誉
example: The novel was acclaimed by critics worldwide.

definition: n. 逆境，困境
example: She showed great courage in the face of adversity.

definition: v. 使隶属，使附属；n. 附属机构
example: The college is affiliated with the university.

definition: v. 加重，恶化；激怒
example: The lack of rain aggravated the drought conditions.

definition: adj. 模棱两可的，含糊不清的
example: The contract contained several ambiguous clauses.

definition: adj. 良性的；和蔼的，温和的
example: Fortunately, the tumor turned out to be benign.

definition: v. 支持，增强；n. 支撑物
example: New evidence bolstered the prosecution's case.

definition: n. 违反，破坏；缺口；v. 违反
example: Sharing the data was a breach of confidentiality.

definition: n. 瀑布，级联；v. 倾泻
example: A cascade of water flowed down the mountainside.

definition: adj. 慢性的；长期的
example: He has been suffering from chronic back pain for years.

definition: adj. 连贯的，一致的；条理清楚的
example: She presented a coherent argument in her essay.

definition: adj. 强制的，义务的
example: Education is compulsory for children aged six to sixteen.

definition: v. 构想，设想；怀孕
example: It is difficult to conceive of a world without the internet.

definition: v. 巩固，加强；合并
example: The company consolidated its position in the market.

definition: v. 沉思，深思熟虑；打算
example: He sat by the lake and contemplated his future.

definition: n. 坚定的信念；定罪
example: She spoke with great conviction about the need for reform.

definition: n. 退化，恶化；堕落
example: Environmental degradation is a serious global problem.

definition: v. 描绘，描述
example: The painting depicts a scene from rural life.

definition: v. 恶化，变坏
example: His health began to deteriorate rapidly.

definition: n. 差异，不一致
example: There is a discrepancy between the two reports.

definition: v. 拥抱；欣然接受；n. 拥抱
example: The company embraced new technology to improve efficiency.

definition: adj. 经验主义的，以实验为依据的
example: The theory is supported by empirical evidence.

definition: v. 努力，尽力；n. 努力，尝试
example: We should endeavor to make the world a better place.

definition: v. 侵蚀，腐蚀；逐渐削弱
example: Wind and rain have eroded the cliffs over centuries.

definition: v. 升级，扩大；加剧
example: Tensions between the two countries continued to escalate.

definition: adj. 可行的，行得通的
example: The engineers assessed whether the project was feasible.

definition: n. 缺陷，瑕疵；v. 使有缺陷
example: A small flaw in the glass made it worthless.

definition: v. 波动，变动
example: Oil prices fluctuate depending on global demand.

definition: adj. 真正的，真实的；真诚的
example: She showed genuine concern for his well-being.

definition: v. 妨碍，阻碍；n. 大篮子
example: Bad weather hampered the rescue efforts.

definition: adj. 危险的，有害的
example: Workers must wear protective gear when handling hazardous materials.

definition: v. 照亮；阐明，启发
example: The research illuminated the causes of the disease.

definition: v. 使沉浸，使浸入；使专心于
example: She immersed herself in the study of ancient history.

definition: adj. 紧迫的，必要的；n. 必要的事
example: It is imperative that we act immediately.

definition: n. 推动力，促进因素；动力
example: The new policy gave fresh impetus to economic reform.

definition: adj. 精巧的，巧妙的；有创造力的
example: She devised an ingenious solution to the problem.

definition: v. 恐吓，威胁；使胆怯
example: The witness was intimidated into changing her statement.

definition: n. 管辖权，司法权；管辖范围
example: The case falls outside the jurisdiction of this court.

definition: adj. 合法的，正当的；合理的
example: The workers have a legitimate claim to higher wages.

definition: adj. 货币的，金融的
example: The central bank adjusted its monetary policy.

definition: adj. 微不足道的，可以忽略的
example: The difference in cost was negligible.

definition: v. 培养，养育；n. 养育，培养
example: Parents should nurture their children's creativity.

definition: adj. 模糊的，晦涩的；v. 使模糊
example: The meaning of the poem remains obscure to many readers.

definition: adj. 最重要的，至高无上的
example: The safety of passengers is of paramount importance.

definition: adj. 流行的，普遍的
example: The disease is most prevalent in tropical regions.

definition: n. 熟练，精通
example: She has achieved a high level of proficiency in French.

definition: v. 调和，使和解；协调
example: It was difficult to reconcile the conflicting accounts.

definition: adj. 有弹性的；能迅速恢复的
example: Children are often more resilient than adults expect.

definition: n. 仔细审查，细看
example: The company's financial records came under close scrutiny.

definition: adj. 严格的，严厉的
example: The government imposed stringent regulations on pollution.
